text: <@U4V22C6A1> has joined the channel
_@bsreeharshraj has joined the channel_
_@underwoodvfx has joined the channel_

Hey Sreeharsh, please meet Alex your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
_@dexter has left the channel_
_@dexter has left the channel_

Hi Sreeharsh, nice to meet you!
Here's a small introduction so you could understand my background better. I've been in VFX industry for over 7 years by now. Originally I'm Ukrainian and started my career in Kiev as a generalist. Quickly transitioned to modeling and then to lighting lookdev(because I'm not patient enough to model, I like to have immediate results :slightly_smiling_face: ) After a year in the best company in Kiev I moved to Prague,CZ because I was looking for a much higher level projects. To a certain extent I succeeded just because I could work on films like Warcraft and The Walk.
So after another year I moved to Warsaw, PL to Platige image. It was a lot of fun working there even though it was all about game cinematic. Also I became a lead lighter/environments guy there. I brought  substance painter into pipeline and developed some pipeline tools as well as led development team for a few months. And before leaving platige I became a CG sup as well and after 2 and a half years in total I moved to London.
Here I worked at MPC assets department(one of the best departments of MPC in my opinion) as a lead lookdev with majority of team in Bangalore,India, and after a year in MPC I moved to Framestore London.
So I'm here to answer all you VFX related questions.
Personally I really like playing games,watching films(lately almost exclusively in cinema), tv series(also only the best ones, I don't have time for anything worse than Breaking bad or Chernobyl) and I truly love Japanese art.
I'm not sure about when and how often I'm gonna be available but we will figure this out along the way I guess. So feel free to write me any time but most likely I will be replying in bursts of long replies :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi Alex, Its so nice to meet you.
I'm glad that you agreed to mentor me.
I have finished MY BA Visual Effects at London South Bank university this year and I was a part of VFX Boot camp in London called NextGen Futures. I'll be finishing the boot camp on this Friday, So building my portfolio and looking for a job / internships at the moment.
The area of my interest is modelling & Texturing I would say, and I have got interest in LookDev a bit recently from the bootcamp. So I hope if you can have a look at the work I've done and give me feedback on it would be great.

I personally watch a lot of movies and recommended TV series on my free time.
I'll attach a link of my recent show reel with this, So if you can have a look at it,

Thanks again for doing this.

Harsh
That's great! Sorry just want to clarify, is it Harsh or Sreeharsh?
How was the boot camp? Was it useful?
I will be happy to review your work and give you feedback
Just please give me the link

My first name is Sreeharsh,

But everyone calls me Harsh.
The bootcamp runs great,  we learned several new things, and developed teamwork and soft skills
It helped to make a lot connections and visited few studios
